title: High School Biology Teaching Methodology Design Utilizing Digital Technology

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level biology basics and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: A course to enhance competencies in designing and implementing digital technology-enhanced lessons in biology education, including simulation projects reflecting real school environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more molecular genetics concepts using digital simulation tools (virtual labs, 3D modeling).
Learners can measure project-based learning outcomes by designing ICT-based assessment rubrics.

Trainees design three or more PBL classes using Google Workspace and Padlet in a BYOD environment, and can establish lesson plans meeting evaluation criteria for learner engagement (≥80%), assignment completeness (≥70%), and collaboration efficiency (4/5 points on rubric)
Learners can discover five or more types of biology digital content (AR/VR materials) and adapt them for educational purposes.

resources: Digital Content Creation Tools (Canva Edu, Tinkercad)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
